title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The BidiUtil class in the win32 version of org.eclipse.swt.internal has a line of code that uses Class.forName() to instantiate a Callback object. The specific line is: static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4). This usage causes a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT because NoClassDefFoundError is not defined in the CLDC class libraries.
EB: The line of code using Class.forName() should be changed to: static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4). This change should have the same effect as the original code.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Use the CLDC version of SWT.
2. Verify or use jxeLink or a similar tool.
3. Observe the NoClassDefFoundError when executing the BidiUtil code.
